intro: Silene rubicunda var. revoluta, commonly known as the redstem sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. The species is adapted to arid conditions, with features such as thick leaves and deep root systems that help it survive in harsh climates.
